accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

controlaccess.corpname: Hotel Employees & Restaurant Employees International Union

did.unittitle: Pants Makers Union; [union seal]; Greater New York; Organized 1887

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wool felt, gold appliqu on red background. Gold braid on edges, fringe on V bottom. Hanging loops at top

did.unittitle: Knee Pants Makers Union; Local [union label] No. 19; ACW of A; Affil with AF of L; Org. 1888; New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gold stitching on red background, decorative designs. Union label with sewing machine and scissors in hand. Fringe on over skirt and scalloped bottom. Tassels at bottom. [probably 1933-1937]

did.unittitle: Leisurewear-Robe and Sportswear Workers Union; [eagle with broken chains and union seal with "In Union Victory and Freedom"]; Local 284, ACW of A

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gold stitching on red background with large eagle, union seal on shield over orange-filled "V." gold braid at edges, fringe on bottom. Hangs from loops at top.

did.unittitle: Lithuanian Local 54 Coat Makers; [union seal]; Organized Nov. 13, 1901, Brooklyn, NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two sided banner in English and Lithuanian. Gold stitching on red backing. White center of union seal. Fringe at bottom and on over skirt. Decorative designs. Tassels at bottom. 68 x 46.5 plus tassels and loops

did.unittitle: Wholesale Clothing clerks Union; Local 158, ACW of A [union seal], Chartered 1933

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gold and red edged stitching on blue background. Gold fringe on over-skirt and scalloped bottom. Tassels at bottom. Hangs from loops at top. BACK. Makers label Kraus and Sons, Inc. Union Made, 11 E. 22nd St., NY and Sanitary Union Label A66

did.unittitle: Italian Local 176, Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America [union seal], Brooklyn, NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gold stitching on pale maroon background with laurel leaves under seal and other decorative designs. Fringe at scalloped bottom. Hangs from sleeve at top.

did.unittitle: New York Clothing Cutters Union, [ACWA union label], Local Big 4, ACW of A

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cream stitching on red background. Additional decorative designs. Fringe at top over skirt and scalloped bottom with tassels. Hangs from loops at top

did.unittitle: Italian Local 142, Amalgamated Clothing Workers [ACWA union seal], Coat Tailors, B'klyn, NY

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cream stitching on red background with laurel leaves under seal. Gold braid around edges, tassels on side ropes. Fringe at scalloped bottom, hung from sleeve at top

did.unittitle: Canvas and Pad Makers U (over older text?) of United Brotherhood of Tailors, Local 153 (over older#), Our [union label] Label UGW of A, Affil. With AF of L, Org. July 28, 1910 [over other date] New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cream stitching on red background, fringed overskirt and bottom edge, decorative designs. Tassels at bottom. Hung from loops at top

did.unittitle: Pants Pressers Union, Local 40 [clasped hands], ACW of A [flat iron], Org. May 1907

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cream stitching on red background. Dark gold braid around edges. Fringe at over skirt and bottom (mostly missing). Hangs by sleeve.

did.unittitle: Greater New York Coat Makers [union seal], Local No. 25, Re-Organized April 25, 1932

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meant to be framed. No edging. Outline with gold braid on red background in traditional banner shape with decorative designs. Very light weight.

did.unittitle: New York Joint Board, ACW of A [union label], Organized 1915, New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cream stitching on red background, NY Jt Bd on orange background (covering old stitching?). STITCHED and Reworked OVER older United Garment Workers (UGW of A) organized 1892- banner

did.unittitle: Greater New York Coat Makers [union seal], Local NO. 25, Re-Organized April 25, 1932

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Older true-banner version of #11. Gold stitching on red background, gold braid around edges, decorative stitching, fringe at over skirt and scalloped bottom. Hung by loops. BACK Sanitary Union Label, 993 or 998

did.unittitle: Sheepskin, Leather & Outerwear [ACTWU seal], Local 17, Org. 1932

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Gold writing on red background. White seal in center. ?Nylon?. Gold fringe at bottom. Hangs from sleeve at top.

did.unittitle: Italian Coat Maker Union, Local 63 [clasped hands], ACW of A, Org. 23 April 1913

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Meant to be framed. No edging. Gold braid outlines traditional banner shape on pink background. Image 0160 in frame.

did.unittitle: New York Journeymen Tailors [eagle with American shield] Protective and Benevolent Union Organized 1862 / [back] - Presented By the Ladies of the New York Journeymen Tailors Protective and Benevolent Union August 7[?], 1887

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Cream stitching on blue-green background. Gold braid around edges. Fringe at bottom. Hung from sleeve at top (added later?) / [back]- Cream stitching on cream background with pale gold, red and brown oak and fern branches, nuts and berries Red felt hanging sleeve added later, some added fabric and stitching roughly added long ago to control losses and tears.
